citations.narrative:
Sharp points were found in the enclosure containing a Blue and Gold Macaw and a rooster. There were 3 wooden (2 by
4) perches that were broken leaving the entire metal support (joists) exposed. Two of the chain link walls had exposed
points on the top of the wall. The shade cloth/mesh roof was attached to the outer section of 2 walls, leaving the top
points exposed on the inside of the wall. On the other 2 walls, the roof structure was attached to the inner surface,
effectively blocking the birds access to the sharp points of the chain wall. Both of the birds were free in the enclosure with
access to the sharp points. The primary enclosure must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points
that could potentially injure the birds. The birds were removed from the enclosure during the inspection.
Correct by: 02/20/2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility did not have a documented environment enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their avian
species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan
for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by
the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special
considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently accepted professional
standards.
Correct by: 02/20/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Sharp points were found in the enclosure containing a Blue and Gold Macaw and a rooster. There were 3 wooden (2 by 
4) perches that were broken leaving the entire metal support (joists) exposed. Two of the chain link walls had exposed 
points on the top of the wall. The shade cloth/mesh roof was attached to the outer section of 2 walls, leaving the top 
points exposed on the inside of the wall. On the other 2 walls, the roof structure was attached to the inner surface, 
effectively blocking the birds access to the sharp points of the chain wall. Both of the birds were free in the enclosure with 
access to the sharp points. The primary enclosure must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points 
that could potentially injure the birds. The birds were removed from the enclosure during the inspection.  
Correct by: 02/20/2024 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility did not have a documented environment enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their avian 
species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan 
for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by 
the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special 
considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently accepted professional 
standards. 
Correct by: 02/20/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
